etymologies: late Middle English: from Old French avengier, from a- (from Latin ad ‘to’) + vengier, from Latin vindicare ‘vindicate’

definitions: inflict harm in return for (an injury or wrong done to oneself or another)

examples.text: his determination to avenge the murder of his brother
they are eager to avenge last year's Super Bowl defeat

definitions: inflict harm on behalf of (oneself or someone else previously wronged or harmed)

examples.text: she avenged herself after he broke off their engagement
the warrior swore he would be avenged on their prince

shortDefinitions: inflict harm in return for injury or wrong on behalf of
